t: Job 12
Job Chides His Accusers
Then*p Job responded,
“Truly*pn then you are the people, And*ln with you wisdom will die!
But*ln I have intelligence as well as you; I*ln am not inferior to you. And*ln who does not know such things as these?
I*ln am a joke to my friends, The*ln one who called on God and He answered him; The*ln just and*i blameless man*i is a joke.
He*ln who is at ease holds calamity in contempt, As*ln prepared for those whose feet slip.
The*ln tents of the destroyers prosper, And*ln those who provoke God are secure, Whom*ln God brings into their power.
“But*ln now ask the beasts, and let them teach you; And*ln the birds of the heavens, and let them tell you.
Or*ln speak to the earth, and let it teach you; And*ln let the fish of the sea declare to you.
Who*ln among all these does not know That*ln the hand of the Lord*s has done this,
In*ln whose hand is the life of every living thing, And*ln the breath of all mankind?
Does*ln not the ear test words, As*ln the palate tastes its food?
Wisdom*ln is with aged men, With*iln long life is understanding.
Job Speaks of the Power of God
“With*pn Him are wisdom and might; To*ln Him belong counsel and understanding.
Behold,*ln He tears down, and it cannot be rebuilt; He*ln imprisons a man, and there can be no release.
Behold,*ln He restrains the waters, and they dry up; And*ln He sends them out, and they inundate the earth.
With*ln Him are strength and sound wisdom, The*ln misled and the misleader belong to Him.
He*ln makes counselors walk barefoot And*ln makes fools of judges.
He*ln loosens the bond of kings And*ln binds their loins with a girdle.
He*ln makes priests walk barefoot And*ln overthrows the secure ones.
He*ln deprives the trusted ones of speech And*ln takes away the discernment of the elders.
He*ln pours contempt on nobles And*ln loosens the belt of the strong.
He*ln reveals mysteries from the darkness And*ln brings the deep darkness into light.
He*ln makes the nations great, then destroys them; He*ln enlarges the nations, then leads them away.
He*ln deprives of intelligence the chiefs of the earth’s people And*ln makes them wander in a pathless waste.
They*ln grope in darkness with no light, And*ln He makes them stagger like a drunken man.
